intro: Myobroma fabacea, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves that give it its common name. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
